Notes: Collective language code for Bhojpuri, Magahi, and Maithili

Native name: 中文 (Zhōngwén), 汉语, 漢語

Notes: constructed by International Auxiliary Language Association

Native name: Originally called Occidental; then Interlingue after WWII
Notes: constructed by Edgar de Wahl, first published in 1922
constructed by De Beaufront, 1907, as variation of Esperanto

Native name: ខ្មែរ, ខេមរភាសា, ភាសាខ្មែរ

Notes: macrolanguage, Standard Malay is [zsm], Indonesian is [id/ind]

Language name: Old Church Slavonic, Church Slavonic, Old Bulgarian
Notes: ancient, in use by Orthodox Church

The identifiers mo and mol are deprecated, leaving ro and ron (639-2/T) and rum (639-2/B) the current language identifiers to be used for the variant of the Romanian language also known as Moldavian and Moldovan in English and moldave in French. The identifiers mo and mol will not be assigned to different items, and recordings using these identifiers will not be invalid.
The ISO 639-2/T code srp deprecated the ISO 639-2/B code scc[1]
One of the Reo Mā`ohi (languages of French Polynesia)
